intro: Freyera bornmuelleri, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy fragrance when crushed. Freyera bornmuelleri is valued both for its ornamental appeal and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
